text: 17 nations (including the US) signed the 'Convention du Metre' in Paris, France, establishing the International Bureau of Weights and Measures.

The first public demonstration of a prototype Kinetoscope was given at Edison's laboratory, for approximately 150 members of the National Federation of Women's Clubs. The New York Sun reported on the demonstration.
Robert Baumann obtained a patent for a satellite. (U.S. No. 2,835,548). The patent stipulated the government could use the technology without having to pay royalties.
The Hubble Space Telescope sent its first light image back to Earth, taken with the wide field/planetary camera.
